issue.title: upload images
issue.body:
How can I upload an image?
This is the form I use:
```html
<form action="/admin/images/upload" method="post" enctype="multipart/form-data">
  <fieldset>
    <input name="file" type="file" accept="image/*">
    <input type="submit" value="upload">
  </fieldset>
</form>
```
Using a slightly modified code of the upload example form the docs:
```rust
#[post("/images/upload", format = "image/*", data = "<data>")]
pub fn upload(data: Data) -> io::Result<Redirect> {
    let path = env::temp_dir().join("upload");
    data.stream_to_file(path.clone())?;
    Ok(Redirect::to("/admin/images"))          
}
```
Results in a textfile like this:
```txt
------WebKitFormBoundaryn4rSHTBA207zcMWD
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="file"; filename="foo.jpg"
Content-Type: image/jpeg

Ã¿Ã˜Ã¿Ã 
```
So how can I access the `filename` and how can I stream the image itself?

body: Do you know a quick workaround to support it?

I tried to use [mime_multipart::read_multipart](https://docs.rs/mime_multipart/0.3.4/mime_multipart/fn.read_multipart.html) like this:
`read_multipart(&mut data.open(),true)`
but if fails :(

You should be able to adapt the [multipart crate](https://docs.rs/multipart/0.9.0-alpha.9/multipart/server/struct.Multipart.html) pretty easily here. I can't vouch for it, however, as I haven't tried it myself.

repository.name: multipart
repository.description: A backend-agnostic extension for file uploads in HTTP libraries for Rust

body: Sure! Grabbing lunch now, but can whip something up afterward!
How was the lunch, more importantly how is multipart integration coming?

@Zeludon Lunch was great, thanks! ðŸ˜‹ 

The simplest route towards multipart support is via an existing crate. The most complete of those available is [multipart](https://github.com/abonander/multipart). Unfortunately its API is rather restrictive at the moment, and so it wouldn't be a good fit for Rocket. Nonetheless, I've proposed a change to the API to the author/maintainer at https://github.com/abonander/multipart/issues/58 that would allow its integration with Rocket.

I'm working on a small utility website where I need to upload a csv file from a form. Has there been any progress for this? 

Thanks for this great library, I'm in love with it!
@SergioBenitez If there's any more blockers, let me know.

@shepmaster Thanks for the snippet! One particular concern with your code is that you read all of the form data into memory with no limit. This means that, for instance, if a user uploads a 500MB file, the entire file will reside in memory even though it could have been streamed to disk. Or, worse, if a user sends you data infinitely, the request will exhaust the memory resources on the server, likely crashing it.
What's the status on native integration? Not much else I can do on my end, AFAIK.

@SergioBenitez absolutely, and thank you for pointing that out. However, many people don't need to worry about that level security for their own application for whatever reason. A solution in the hand is worth two in the bush. ðŸ˜º

@abonander My primary concern is correctness. Given that each time (three so far) I've tried to use your library I've run into showstoppers regarding correctness, I'm not particularly confident that it will function as required. I'd like to see https://github.com/abonander/multipart/issues/59 closed. Parsing and networking bugs can be some of the most insidious, and they can lead to extreme confusion when they pop up. I'd really, really like to avoid this.

I tried fuzzing and it found several more bugs; last I tried it, I believe it ran for several hours without issue. Should I let it run overnight? For a week? A month? Should I have it run on CI somehow? I haven't seen any good rule of thumb here.

I've added a number of edge cases to the integration test. No new issues have cropped up, unless there's some you haven't told me about.

@abonander Are you testing potential networking issues somehow? Also, do you have an idea of how the performance of the library compares to some ideal?

Unfortunately, I don't think we're ready to add multipart support directly to Rocket just yet. As such, I'm moving this to 0.4. If no breaking changes are required, we might see this as a point release in 0.3.
